bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John Inglis and Theodora Inglis worked at the American missionary at An Ting Hospital, Peking (Beijing), China, from 1898 to 1900. During their missionary work they witnessed the Siege of Peking in 1900.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Memoirs, correspondence, and clippings relating to the Boxer Rebellion and the siege of Peking (Beijing). Includes papers of Theodora Inglis, wife of J. Inglis. Also includes medals and a printing block.

did.unittitle: "Report of the An Ting Hospital, Peking," by John Inglis, A.M., M.D., physician in charge, 1900
Memorabilia, including a map of Pacific Ocean, and a postcard
Clippings relating to the missionary work of Theodora and John Inglis in Peking and the Peking siege, 1900-1901
Unpublished edition of the letters of John and Theodora Inglis, 1898-1900, compiled by Helen Stote
"Siege in Peking," unpublished manuscript by Theodora Inglis, undated
31 photographs of scenes in China at the time of the Boxer Rebellion
